issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: llap-server/src/main/resources/package.py restricts the keytab URI to support HDFS only and hence fails for other FileSystem API conforming FSs like s3a, wasb, gs, etc.
fields.summary: Keytab URI for LLAP YARN Service is restrictive to support HDFS only

comments.body: Tested this patch in a hadoop cluster based on branch-3.1
/cc [~thejas]. Post review it should be committed to branch-3 and master.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12947860 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

bq. Wouldn't this break backward compat for paths specified the old way? We can check the path for being the full URI and append if it's not. +-0
[~sershe] not to worry. This will not cause any backward incompatibility. Any store conforming to hadoop FS API will work, including relative paths based on fs.defaultFS value. In fact, if you look at history including Slider - these 2 lines of code did not even exist. It was added only recently due to the constraint that YARN Service imposed to support hdfs and file URIs only, which now has been removed with YARN-9002.
Committed to master and branch-3. Thanks [~gsaha] for the patch!
